name: Courtyard by Marriott Vallejo Napa Valley

reviews.text: It should be a crime to call this a Marriot. It is more like a ratty Super 8!
reviews.title: Avoid like the plague!!!'

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are TINY with everything crammed in. They put us in a room that they KNEW the air conditioner didn't work. When we called the maintence guy came up and said he didn't have time to fix it and he hoped it would work intermittently throughout the night.
reviews.title: Extraordinary!

reviews.text: The front desk was awful! Did not care that we were unhappy. So see we're stuck two nights in the ghetto marriot! Yuck!
reviews.title: I expected more.

reviews.text: The staff on late notice and over the phone arranged accommodations for a handicap couple visiting Discovery Kingdom over a busy weekend. Sid went far and beyond in assisting me with the required forms to secure a wonderful room for these weary two. The best service I’ve every experienced from the desk!
reviews.title: The place to stay when visiting Six Flags Discovery Kingdom

reviews.text: Professional, compassionate and competent!
reviews.title: Nice hotel located across the street from Six Flags Discovery

reviews.text: Stayed here recently for two nights while visiting Six Flags Discovery Kingdom. The hotel was clean and the staff, particularly the front desk staff, were friendly and helpful. I requested adjoining rooms when making my reservations online and my request was honored. We chose this hotel due to its close proximity to Discovery Kingdom and would not hesitate to stay here again.
reviews.title: The place to stay when visiting Discovery Kingdom

reviews.text: The small children with us enjoyed the hot tub and swimming pool. We didn't watch much TV but I did notice that they are older, composite video input, non HD sets. The recreation room was very well equipped. There were many families with small children staying here but I never heard any noise once we were inside the rooms.
reviews.title: Great Customer Service, good local to Six Flags

reviews.text: The only criticism I would have is the hotel restaurant. I have stayed at hotels that have better complimentary breakfast buffets than what you get charged for here. The cost for 3 adults and 3 small children was over $50. The food quality was poor. There are a number of restaurants within 5 miles of the hotel that we would dine at instead should we stay here again.
reviews.title: Remodeled holiday inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this Courtyard because of the location to the Six Flags. We are a family of 4 and were pleased with the easy walking distance to the park entrance, which is literally right across the street. As far as the hotel is concerned our stay was great. Due to the dates we stayed, we couldn't get a double queen room, but only a king plus sofa bed. Our two teenage girls did fit snuggly on the sofa bed, but they did say it was comfortable. Our room didn't have a view, but that was fine. The room was comfortable and updated. Bathroom was very roomy for all 4 to use.
reviews.title: On the plus side of average

reviews.text: Lobby was a comfortable place to wait for our friends around the fireplace. Also had a courtesy computer and printer, which we did use as I forgot to print out some of our tickets. We did sit around some of the tables in the lobby for a lunch, which we packed, but the staff was happy to get plates, utensils, and napkins upon request. I would like to see coffee offered in the lobby at all times, as I am an avid coffee drinker. That said, the coffee, when offered was actually decent, unlike the cheap stuff most hotels offer.
reviews.title: I expected more from this hotel

reviews.text: We found this place through a groupon, a room, a bottle of wine and two free breakfast buffets were included. I think the wine won me over, this place was nice and was the perfect place to start out from to go to Napa in the morning. Nothing special in the rooms, except for those really heavenly comforters that are like sleeping in a cloud.
reviews.title: Good location for going to Napa vineyards

reviews.text: Our family of 5 (kids--13, 12, 10) stayed one night to enjoy two days at Six Flags Discovery Kingdom. The hotel is literally across from the park so you can't beat the convenience. The front desk, housekeeping, and restaurant/bar staff were very professional and friendly. We asked for 2 connecting rooms and had no problem getting them. The rooms were very clean and nicely appointed for the price range, but on the small size for US hotels. Although the breakfast was not included (about $10 for adults and $5-6 for kids), it was very tasty and offered a good variety from waffles, cook to order eggs, boxed cereals, and fresh sliced fruit. You could also order off an ala carte menu. Breakfast was relaxing because the staff wasn't chasing you out (like other hotels do) when breakfast hours ended. When we checked out the second day, we were allowed at no extra charge to store our luggage while we enjoyed Six Flags again. My only complaint was that the old-fashioned air conditioners for each room were quite noisy even with just the fan on. Note to Hotel: Please upgrade air conditioners. Otherwise a great stay!
reviews.title: Good Value with Friendly Staff

reviews.text: Good, safe location right off I-80. Ten minutes to Six Flags, better than staying in Vallejo Ghetto! Pros: The staff here was very friendly, the rooms are comfortable, and the hot tub was nice, food wasn't bad at the restaurant. Cons: the pool was a bit cold (heat that baby!), no ice machine on the 2nd floor (Priceline floor), view of a wall and the freeway (yep, probably the Priceline room again) and you have to pay for breakfast.
reviews.title: Great for a trip to Discovery Kingdom & Jelly Belly Factory

reviews.text: Overall it was just what I needed on this trip with my 8 year old daughter to Six Flags. We felt safe and enjoyed our stay.
reviews.title: The Best hotel if you are staying overnight for Six Flags

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for my daughter's 13th Birthday celebration trip. We travelled from Tahoe to Vallejo & stayed overnight so that we could be at the park first thing in the morning and rested. We arrived & our room was spacious & quiet, the beds were not as comfortable and plush as normal marriott beds we have stayed in, as they did not have the feather bedding or pillows, but everything was clean and organized. We had a partial view of the park. The hotel is very close to a shopping center if you forget anything, there is a Target & a few food venues (Olive Garden, taco bell, etc.) across the freeway and about 2-3 miles away. The hotel was able to offer us a discount on the park tickets too which was great. We woke up early for our breakfast buffet, which was included in our room rate and it was a welcome, substantial breakfast, with made to order omelets, oatmeal, cereal, breads, donuts, sausage, bacon, waffles, scrambled eggs, & juices, coffee, etc. We had a great time at the park the next day & then stayed at the hotel another night. We had a few family members who joined us at the park who live locally in the bay area & we went back to our room to relax afterwards & we ordered up some pizza from the hotel (they only offer pizza at the hotel for evening food). It was pretty good. All in all, we would stay here again if we were to visit the Six flags park again in the future & it was comfortable & quiet, just not as plush & up to date as a regular marriott.
reviews.title: Best hotel for Six Flags

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were attending a wedding in Sonoma and stayed here as it was much less expensive than anything closer. It's right across from a theme park but we didn't hear the noise. This hotel is a place where families stay when going to the theme park so very busy especially at the beginning and end of the day. We were a bit concerned as we've stayed in hotel with a lot of kids before and it was noisy but not the case here. Our room was nice and we never heard a sound once inside.
reviews.title: Nice hotel with convenient location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's very convenient to both the I-80 and the 37 which heads towards wine country.
reviews.title: Wonderful staff

reviews.text: The only time it became an issue was breakfast but that was due to parents letting their kids run around and serve themselves at the buffet. The buffet was really not that good - the food all tasted the same and although they had someone supposed to make omelets to order I waited for 10 minutes and no one showed up so I ended up just eating the scrambled eggs in the warmer. We'd probably opt out of breakfast next time.
reviews.title: Lovely stay

reviews.text: One good thing was free Wi-Fi for 24 hours!
reviews.title: Good location for Napa Valley

reviews.text: We usually stay here when going to the drag races. We are always treated very well. We stayed from 07/26/12-7/30/12. We had a problem with septic odors in our room. They did everything they could to accommodate us until an open room was available. While we were out, they moved all of our belongings into a new room and we had no more issues. Alaine, in particular, was just wonderful. Not only did she get us a new room, but she also gave us 2 complimentary breakfasts. Thank you to all of your wonderful staff in Vallejo. We will continue to stay with you anytime we are in the area.
reviews.title: A review with kids in mind......

aka: Courtyard By Marriott Vallejo Napa Valley Hotel Vallejo
